data.text:
@tyrantraveomega @TaleSpun I'm actually pretty neutral on his artstyle (though the monsters stand out)

The character models in DQXI REALLY stand out though

@TaleSpun @Shock_and_Roll while i do respect a lot of the artists has had over the years, i have always been more of a fan of toriyama's designs myself, mainly his monsters. they're always so whimsical and charming. like the puppeteer from DQ8
@tyrantraveomega @Shock_and_Roll Yeah, it seems like they’ve grappled with it far better than FF has, honestly. FF has good models and animations, but the art direction really peeked at FFXII.
@TaleSpun @Shock_and_Roll it's always been fun to look at FF vs DQ. DQ is sooo consistent in quality and it sounds like they handled the HD transition amazingly
@Shock_and_Roll Oh yeah, when he brought that up it reminded me of a specific moment in the first half of DQ8 that was surprisingly dark, just the way he was describing.

@TaleSpun Tim wasn't kidding about the story being deceptively good

Dragon Quest V's story really hit me when I played it when I was younger. I'm feeling confident about that "oh shit" moment
@Shock_and_Roll Man, right? I always thought the game looked really good, but I was *shocked* at how detailed the towns seem to be. This is the antithesis to FFXIII lmao

@TaleSpun The dream of being able to go from detailed town to detailed town

I've wanted that since forever, and the fact that it's actually a thing is just... it's brilliant
@Shock_and_Roll Just going by Tim’s video it seems like it’s tip-top design. Honestly wish the weekend were over already. LOL haven’t been this hyped in a while.
@TaleSpun The game just looks unbelievably solid
